abstract: Going online at a Starbucks over a Wi-Fi connection will cost less money or will even be free, thanks to a new deal between the coffee chain and AT&T.
snippet: Going online at a Starbucks over a Wi-Fi connection will cost less money or will even be free, thanks to a new deal between the coffee chain and AT&T.
lead_paragraph: The idea of city-sponsored Wi-Fi seems to be floundering. And the fancy wireless service that may come of the government spectrum auction will be many years away. But that doesn’t mean that there’s nothing new for road warriors who want a connection.

headline.main: Cheaper Wi-Fi Access at Starbucks and Beyond
